steps.step: Dissolving squaric acid and CoCl2.6H2O in H2O
steps.details: A mixture of squaric acid and CoCl2.6H2O was dissolved in 7 mL of H2O.
Under stirring, KOH was added to the mixture.
The mixture was finally transferred to a 25 mL Teflon-lined reactor.
The reactor was heated to 220 °C for 48 h.
After heating, the reactor was cooled to room temperature within several hours.
The sample was filtrated and washed with deionized water several times.
Then exchanged with deionized water for 3 days (2 times/day) prior to activation.

synthesis.washing_method: Washed with deionized water several times
synthesis.drying_method: Exchanged with deionized water for 3 days
